arm_group.description: The intervention group received a pre-dive checklist and a post-dive log
The control group received the post-dive log only.

brief_summary.textblock:
To evaluate the efficacy of using a pre-dive checklist to prevent the incidence of diving
      mishaps in recreational divers.

clinical_study.brief_title: Common Recreational Diving Practices: A Randomized Control Trial Using Pre-Dive Checklist

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Over 18 years of age

          -  Having a valid Diver Certification

          -  Deemed fit by the Dive operator to dive on the day of participation

          -  Planning to dive on the day of participation

          -  Have basic knowledge of English

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Anyone not meeting all of the inclusion criteria

          -  A diver who did not answer the outcomes questionnaire was later excluded

intervention.description: The pre-dive checklist included a checklist of tasks to be undertaken before the dive, a dive-plan that asked the diver to plan the depth, and amount of gas kept at different levels of diving, and 4 dive tips.

clinical_study.official_title: A Group Randomized Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy of Using Pre-dive Checklist to Prevent the Incidence of Recreational Scuba Diving Mishaps

primary_outcome.description: Mishaps were reported by scuba divers themselves, at the end of their diving day (the day they were enrolled). Mishaps are precursors of injuries. Injuries are less common outcomes (in fact, nobody got injured), hence we used mishaps - which allowed us to test the efficacy of pre-dive checklists, and do so with limited resources.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Major mishaps are a type of mishaps
Minor mishaps are a type of mishaps

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention
